column1: These may not be connected records.
There is no observer or altitude on the first sheet, so only information is gauge was in Devonport
The observer for the 1850s was a T Lancaster
There are 2 possible T Lancasters according to the 1851 census
Thomas Lancaster was a jeweler at 56 Queen St, and was there from 1830s onward
Thomas Lancaster was a land surveyor in 4 Queen St and also there in the 1840s
118ft altitude includes the 38ft above ground noted on sheet.
If this is accurate this NGR is the only part of Queen Street that is around 80ft altitude
